text: Quercus lanata, the woolly-leaved oak, is a species of Quercus native to southern and southeastern Asia (Himalayas, Assam, Bhutan, Nepal, Indochina (Vietnam, Myanmar, northern Thailand), and southwestern China (Guangxi, Tibet, Yunnan)). It is a large tree up to 30 m tall, evergreen. Leaves are thick and leathery, green on top but covered in thick wool on the underside. ==References== ==External links== lanata Category:Trees of China Category:Flora of Indo-China Category:Plants described in 1819 Category:Trees of India Category:Trees of Nepal Category:Trees of the Indian subcontinent
title: Quercus lanata
